repnme.cdata!:
Western Africa - BCEAO Regional Payment
            Systems Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the BCEAO (Central Bank of
            West African States) Regional Payment Systems Project for
            Western Africa were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory,
            the risk to development outcome was moderate, the Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            payment system projects are complex, and building
            understanding, capacity and necessary consensus can not be
            underestimated in terms of the time needed nor in terms of
            financial resources especially in an eight country
            sub-region. Before undertaking a technically and
            managerially complex project, the Bank needs to place a
            special emphasis on assuring that adequate institutional and
            procurement capacity is in place. Finally, with the
            Bank's current emphasis on access to finance, a payment
            systems project today may be structured differently: such a
            project will probably not only focus on improvements in
            wholesale markets, i.e. systemically important, but also on
            all segments of retail markets where emphasis may be less on
            competition and more on cooperation.

437785.trustfund:
TF036540-SENEGAL - WATER SUPPLY PROJECT,TF034912-AFRICA REGION - UEMOA REG. SEC.
            EXCH., BUKINA FASO - PRIVATE SEC.,TF025076-PHRD-BCEAO REGIONAL PAYMENT SYSTEMS

repnme.cdata!:
Western Africa - BCEAO Regional Payment
            Systems Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The BCEAO (Central Bank of West African
            States) Regional Payment Systems Project aims to establish
            and install a set of regional payment mechanisms to satisfy
            the evolving needs of all market sectors in the West African
            Economic and Monetary Union (WAEMU) for making payments in a
            safe, sound, secure, and timely manner with certainty and at
            an acceptable cost. A secondary objective is that the new
            payments systems satisfy internationally accepted standards
            and core principles and thus ensure a high level of user
            confidence in the WAEMU financial systems. The project has
            five components: The project support component includes
            project management and monitoring, training, and
            procurement. The RTGS component establishes a real time
            gross settlement system at the regional level, which
            includes transaction monitoring, management of settlement
            accounts, management of transactions queues, exchange of
            information with participants, and intra-day liquidity
            management. The low value clearing component upgrades
            existing systems at the national and regional levels. The
            inter-bank card system develops a common bank card product,
            enabling use in any ATM or participating merchant's
            facility in the sub-region. The project includes a
            feasibility study on the use of e-money systems for small
            payments. For all three payments systems in this project,
            the BCEAO's telecommunications satellite network would
            be used to effect transactions with a degree of security and
            at low cost.
